summary: Allows you to hire the Ferryman even when your character is over-encumbered
descriptionHtml:
Update: someone requested a BSA version of the mod to keep their script folder clean, so I\'ve uploaded it. If you are using the Nexus Mod Manager to install mods, I recommend you download the BSA version instead of the loose file version (load order of the \'NoEncumbranceFerryman.esp\' does not matter). If you are using the Mod Organizer, then it doesn\'t really matter which version you use (just make sure you do not install both).

No Encumbrance Ferryman

==================
Requirements:
==================

- Dawnguard DLC


==================
Description:
==================

*Dawnguard DLC is required*

Ever wonder why you can\'t hire the Ferryman when your character is (even slightly) over-encumbered? A Skyrim update removed the encumbrance check for carriages, but hasn\'t done the same for ferries, so I thought I\'d take some initiative.

This mod removes the encumbrance check for ferries so your character can hire the ferryman even if s/he is over-encumbered.


==================
Details:
==================

I simply commented out the appropriate lines for the encumbrance check in the ferryman script. Clean and simple.

This mod will conflict with any mod that edits the ferryman script from Dawnguard. Otherwise, there will be no possible conflict what-so-ever.


==================
Installation:
==================

I use the Mod Organizer. I highly recommend it because unlike manual installation or traditional mod managers, it will not install files directly into your game data folder, so there is no chance of leaving behind orphan files when you uninstall mods.

Otherwise, to install manually, just extract the archive into the game folder. Might want to double check to make sure \'FerrySystemScript.pex\' is in the .../data/script/ folder.


==================
Un-Installation:
==================

Uninstall using the same mod manager you installed it with. If uninstalling manually, delete \'FerrySystemScript.pex\' from .../data/script folder. That\'s it.

It\'s not a new script, but a modified copy of a base DLC script, so it won\'t leave orphan crap in your save game or spam your papyrus log.


==================
Changelog:
==================

21/04/2013 - BSA version uploaded
21/01/2013 - Initial Release

==================
Contact Details:
==================

My username is Ripple on both the official Bethesday forums and the Nexus. You know the rest.


==================
Credits:
==================

Thanks to Bethesda for creating Skyrim.
Thanks to the Oblivion/Fallout 3/Fallout NV/Skyrim modding communities for advice and help throughout the years. 


==================
Licensing/Legal:
==================

It\'s a very simple (and hopefully clean) fix. You can do whatever you want with this. It took me longer to type up this readme than to edit/re-compile the script.
